creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by the artist with the assistance of Keiko Gallery
description: red lacquer; abstract, irregular form resembling the shape of a cat's head; small slit near upper center surrounded by rugged, raised surface; hole in bottom echoing shape of figure, exposing black interior with beige paint; rests on dark blue pillow
text: Sasai’s femininity and her experience as a mother are reflected in this work and the nearby sculpture Beloved. Here, she sought to convey an image of a woman and a child.
title: Acceptable
